resources.string: What is Privacy Friendly Pain Diary?

Privacy Friendly Pain Diary is an app that allows you to make daily diary entries recording your condition and the intensity, location, nature and time of the pain you feel, as well as the medication you take and additional notes.
What makes the app privacy friendly?
Privacy Friendly Pain Diary requires minimal permissions. It does not include any tracking mechanisms or advertisement.
Which permissions does the app require?
Privacy Friendly Pain Diary requires write access to your device\'s storage if you wish to export your diary entries to PDF. All other features do not require any permissions.
How do I add a new diary entry?
A new diary entry can be added by selecting a day in the calendar. There can however only be one entry per day. Days for which entries already exist are marked in the calendar.
Which information is recorded in a diary entry?
Diary entries can be used to document your condition and the intensity, location, nature and time of the pain you feel. The medication you take and additional notes can also be recorded.
Do I have to enter user details?

The app does not require you to enter any user details. You are free to enter your name, date of birth and gender and you can delete information you previously entered at any time. The information you enter is not shared or transmitted in any way.
How can I export my diary entries?
You can export all diary entries made within a period of time that you specify. You also have the option to share that PDF. Select the menu item "PDF Export" to do so.
Karola Marky, Susanne Felsen, Rybien Sinjari
This application belongs to the group of Privacy Friendly Apps developed by Technische Universit√§t Darmstadt. Sourcecode licensed under GPLv3. Images copyright TU Darmstadt and Google Inc.

Delete all diary entries and user details
All diary entries and user details will be deleted irrevocably.\nAre you sure?
The medication last entered is automatically added to new entries
This app allows you to make daily diary entries recording your condition and the intensity, location, nature and time of the pain you feel, as well as the medication you take and additional notes.

The main view of this app is a calendar. You can add a new diary entry by selecting a day in this calendar. You will then be asked to answer questions regarding your condition and the pain you are experiencing.
At the end of this tutorial you will be asked to enter your user details. This step is optional and can be skipped. User details can also be entered or deleted at a later point.
The sourcecode of this app is available at GitHub. For further explanations have a look at the help page or the Privacy Friendly App Guide.
The information you have entered will be lost. Do you want to continue?
(0 = no pain, 10 = very strong pain (on the verge of fainting))
What is the nature of your pain?
Do you have any additional comments?
Press the green plus to add new medications. Enter the quantity (e. g. number of pills) you take in the morning, at noon, in the evening and at night.
Are you sure you want to delete this diary entry?
Don\'t forget to make your daily pain diary entry!
Please select a range of dates for which your pain diary entries should be exported as PDF.
